problems.title: Loss of Suction Power
problems.description: Restoring suction power to your Shark Apex losing suction.
possible_causes: Blockage in the wand or hose
solution_steps: Check for blockages in the vacuum head
Inspect the wand and hose for clogs
Remove any debris from the air pathways

required_parts.name: Shark Apex losing suction Replacement Filter
required_parts.search_query: Shark Apex losing suction suction problem

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the suction on a Shark Apex losing suction?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter or seal typically costs significantly less than a new $575 vacuum, and extending the life of your Shark is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Shark Apex losing suction needs a new filter or seal?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter or seal on my Shark Apex losing suction myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
